name: Mikko Hyppönen
background: Chief Research Officer at F-Secure (now WithSecure). Tracked major malware families since 1991. TED speaker on cybercrime. Creator of Hyppönen's Law: 'If it's smart, it's vulnerable.'

principles.name: If it's smart, it's vulnerable
principles.description: Any device with a computer in it can be hacked. IoT, smart cars, medical devices—connectivity creates attack surface. Offline is the only secure.
principles.falsification: When airgapped systems are compromised through supply chain or physical access

principles.name: Attribution is hard, consequences are easy
principles.description: You may never know who attacked you, but you'll definitely feel the damage. Focus on resilience over retaliation. Assume breach.
principles.falsification: When clear attribution enables effective deterrence

principles.name: Malware evolves faster than defenses
principles.description: Signature-based detection is always behind. Behavior-based and heuristic approaches are necessary but imperfect. The attacker sets the pace.
principles.falsification: When AI-based detection achieves near-zero false negatives
